critique: This executive order focuses on earthquake safety for federal buildings and federally assisted or regulated buildings. It mandates compliance with earthquake-resistant design and construction codes and standards. It doesn't directly address ideological issues, immigration, executive power in a broad sense, or social inclusion. It does touch on federalism by setting federal standards, and economic regulation by mandating certain building codes, and national security by improving resilience to disasters. The order revokes two previous executive orders on the same topic, suggesting a continuation of existing policy with updates. It includes exemption authority for law enforcement, national security, or public safety reasons.
